Detailed Description

This class implements methods for accessing static and run-time SBW configuration information.

The information includes the SBW installation directory, the user runtime directory, and the SBW session key file. This class is used internally by SBW and is not intended to be used by user modules.

Definition at line 72 of file SBWConfig.h.

Member Function Documentation

std::string Config::getLibDirectory (    )  [static]
 

This returns the SBW "lib" directory for this SBW installation.

The directory pathname is obtained by appending "/lib" to the directory pathname returned by Config::getSBWHome().

Returns:
the full lib directory path for this SBW installation
Exceptions:
SBWCommunicationException  if the SBW installation directory is unknown (and thus the lib directory cannot be determined)

Definition at line 251 of file SBWConfig.cpp.

References TRACE.

std::string Config::getRuntimeFilesDirectory (    )  [static]
 

This method returns the pathname of the SBW runtime information directory for this user.

The runtime directory has the form

HOME/.sbw/runtime/IPADDRESS

where HOME/.sbw is the path to the ".sbw" subdirectory in the user's home directory (i.e., the path returned by Config::getSBWUserDir()) and IPADDRESS is the IP address of this computer.

Returns:
a string, the pathname of the SBW runtime files directory
Exceptions:
SBWCommunicationException  if this method cannot determine the host name or network address.

std::string Config::getSBWHome (    )  [static]
 

This looks for the SBW home directory, attempting different approaches one after the other until one succeeds or they all fail:.

  1. If the environment variable SBW_HOME is set, it returns the value.

  2. Else, if this is a Windows system, it tries to read the registry entry for SBW and returns the value stored with the key.

  3. Else, it looks for a file called "config.properties" in a subdirectory named ".sbw" in the user's home directory, and tries to read the property setting for "sbw.home" out of that.

  4. Else, if that file does not exist and this is running under Windows, it makes a final attempt to find the file in the Windows system directory (e.g., /WINNT/system32).
Returns:
a string representing the pathname to the SBW home directory
Exceptions:
SBWRawException  if the attempt to read the Windows registry entry for SBW failed
SBWCommunicationException  if it cannot determine the SBW installation directory after trying all the approaches

Definition at line 105 of file SBWConfig.cpp.

References getSBWUserDir, and TRACE.

std::string Config::getSBWUserDir (    )  [static]
 

Returns the path to the user's ".sbw" subdirectory.

This subdirectory should be located in the user's home directory. The approach to find the user's home directory depends on the operating system:

  • If the operating system is Windows, the user's home folder is determined using Windows API calls.

  • If the operating system is Unix/Linux, the user's home directory is taken to be the value of the environment variable "HOME".
Returns:
a string, the pathname to the SBW user directory
Exceptions:
SBWCommunicationException  if the user's home directory cannot be determined under Unix

std::string Config::getSessionKeyFile (    )  [static]
 

Returns the pathname of the SBW session key file for this SBW session.

The pathname is the result of appending the file name "key" to the directory returned by Config::getRuntimeFilesDirectory().

Returns:
a string, the pathname of the SBW session key file
